Package com.availaboard.engine.sql_connection

Class AvailaboardSQLConnection

java.lang.Object
com.availaboard.engine.sql_connection.AvailaboardSQLConnection
public class AvailaboardSQLConnection extends Object
Connects to the Availaboard database. Uses the ConfigPropReader to get the information needed to connect.

  • Constructor Details

    • AvailaboardSQLConnection

      public AvailaboardSQLConnection()

  • Method Details

    • authenticate

      public void authenticate(String username, String password) throws InvalidCredentialsException
      Check's if a username and password are valid. If they are not the method throws a InvalidCredentialsException.
      Parameters:
      username - Passed into database to check if exists.
      password - Passed into database to check if exists.
      Throws:
      InvalidCredentialsException - Thrown if both a username and password don't exist in the same row.

    • createResourceWithID

      public <E extends Resource> E createResourceWithID(int ID, Class<E> type)
      Creates and returns a Resource Object based off a Class and a ResourceID. The Method iterates through every field of the class reflectively and sets each of them to the value of a column with an identical name. It then manually sets the Status and Name of the Resource .
      Type Parameters:
      E - The type of Object that the method is grabbing and returning from the database.
      Parameters:
      ID - The ID used to identify which E should be grabbed from the database.
      type - The type of Object that the method is grabbing and returning from the database.
      Returns:
      A E Object with every field set from the database.

    • createUserWithUsername

      public User createUserWithUsername(String username)
      Creates a User from a Username. Uses createResourceWithID(int, java.lang.Class<E>) and getResourceIDFromUsername(java.lang.String) to create it.
      Parameters:
      username - used to create the User Object.
      Returns:
      A new User.

    • loadResources

      public <E extends Resource> Collection<E> loadResources(Class<E> type)
      Loads all Resource in the database of a given type (E). Iterates through every ResourceID in the E table and creates an E object from that ID. It then adds all of them to an ArrayList and returns.
      Type Parameters:
      E - The type of Object that the method is grabbing and returning from the database.
      Parameters:
      type - The type of Object that the method is grabbing and returning from the database.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of the type E loaded from the database.

    • setType

      public void setType(Resource res, String value, Field field)
      Sets the value of a Field. The reason there is a Method for this action is because since the values are being set reflectively if the value is an Enum then the program breaks down because an Enum value can not be set by a String without Enum.valueOf
      Parameters:
      res - The Resource Object that contains the Field that will be set.
      value - The value that the Field will be set to.
      field - The Field that the Method will set.

    • updateFieldToDatabase

      public void updateFieldToDatabase(Resource res, Field field)
      Updates a Field in a Resource object to the corresponding column in the database.
      Parameters:
      res - The Resource that will be updated.
      field - The Field that will be updated.

    • updateRowInDatabase

      public void updateRowInDatabase(Resource res, Field field)
      Updates a column in the database to the corresponding Field in the Resource.
      Parameters:
      res - The Resource that has a value in a Field that will be used to update the database.
      field - A Field that has a value that will be used to update the database.

    • doesUsernameExist

      public boolean doesUsernameExist(String username)
      Checks if a Username exists in the database.
      Parameters:
      username - The username being against the database for if it exists or not.

    • insertResourceIntoDatabase

      public void insertResourceIntoDatabase(Resource res) throws UsernameExistsException
      Inserts a Resource subclass into the database.
      Parameters:
      res - The Resource that is being inserted into the database.
      Throws:
      UsernameExistsException
